Package com.springproject.orgschart.service

Class EmployeeServiceImplementation

java.lang.Object
com.springproject.orgschart.service.EmployeeServiceImplementation
All Implemented Interfaces:
EmployeeService
@Service public class EmployeeServiceImplementation extends Object implements EmployeeService
The EmployeeServiceImplementation class is responsible for handling employee-related operations by implementing the EmployeeService interface. It interacts with the EmployeeRepository and LevelRepository to access employee data and level information from the database.

      public EmployeeServiceImplementation(EmployeeRepository employeeRepository, LevelRepository levelRepository)

      Parameters:
      employeeRepository - The employee repository to be used for accessing employee data.
      levelRepository - The level repository to be used for accessing level information.

  • Method Details

    • getAllEmployeesSortedByName

      public List<EmployeeDTO> getAllEmployeesSortedByName()
      Retrieves a list of all employees sorted by name.
      Specified by:
      getAllEmployeesSortedByName in interface EmployeeService
      Returns:
      The list of EmployeeDTO objects representing all employees, sorted by name.
      Throws:
      DataNotFoundException - if the list of employees is empty.

    • getEmployeeOrganizationChart

      public OrganizationChartDTO getEmployeeOrganizationChart(Long employeeId)
      Retrieves the organization chart for a specific employee.
      Specified by:
      getEmployeeOrganizationChart in interface EmployeeService
      Parameters:
      employeeId - The ID of the employee.
      Returns:
      The OrganizationChartDTO containing the employee's information, manager, colleagues, and direct reports.

    • addEmployee

      public EmployeeDTO addEmployee(EmployeeDTO employeeDTO)
      Adds a new employee to the database.
      Specified by:
      addEmployee in interface EmployeeService
      Parameters:
      employeeDTO - The EmployeeDTO object representing the new employee to be added.
      Returns:
      The EmployeeDTO object representing the newly added employee.
      Throws:
      NameNotNullException - if the employee name is null or empty.
      InvalidManagerLevelException - if the employee's manager level is invalid.
      DuplicateEmployeeException - if an employee with the same name already exists.
      MultipleDirectorException - if multiple directors are attempted to be added.
      InvalidManagerIdException - if the specified manager ID is invalid(exceeds the number of employees in the db).

    • replaceEmployee

      public boolean replaceEmployee(Long employeeId, EmployeeDTO employeeDTO)
      Replaces the details of an existing employee with new details.
      Parameters:
      employeeId - The ID of the employee to be replaced.
      employeeDTO - The updated EmployeeDTO object representing the employee's new details.
      Returns:
      true if the employee is successfully replaced, false otherwise.

    • updateEmployeeDetails

      public boolean updateEmployeeDetails(Long employeeId, EmployeeDTO employeeDTO)
      Updates the details of an existing employee with new details.
      Parameters:
      employeeId - The ID of the employee to be replaced.
      employeeDTO - The updated EmployeeDTO object representing the employee's new details.
      Returns:
      true if the employee is successfully updated, false otherwise.

    • deleteEmployee

      public boolean deleteEmployee(Long employeeId)
      Deletes an employee from the database.
      Specified by:
      deleteEmployee in interface EmployeeService
      Parameters:
      employeeId - The ID of the employee to be deleted.
      Returns:
      true if the employee is successfully deleted, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      EmployeeNotFoundException - if the employee with the specified ID is not found.
